author: ryanleeschneider
content:
Reposting Micah's comment in case he doesnt join over here, as I think it's a good counter-argument:

> I'm against this for the same reason I'm against all forms of on-chain governance.  Every change should be opt-in, never opt-out.  This would make it so some multisig can set the TTD to whatever they want and users would have to opt-out of that change to the ruleset.

But counter-counter-argument: then maybe the client should still offer an override option, and possibly an option to ignore the contracts TTD completely

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Or if you prefer, command line argument to opt in to getting TTD from the contract.  But in many ways you'd already be opting in by installing the release that starts watching the contract.

I also don't think adding a remote controlled trigger is the right direction. Better to know the triggers in your software when you choose to run that software
